channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syria, once home to a large Jewish community, takes steps to return property to Jews
item.description: A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.

item.title: What we know about Savannah Guthrie's missing mother
item.description: Nancy Guthrie is 84 and has mobility issues, but she is mentally sharp, Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos said. She was last seen Saturday evening at he...

item.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
item.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market...

item.title: NASA delays the launch of Artemis II lunar mission by at least a month
item.description: NASA is targeting March for the launch of four astronauts on a ten-day mission to circle the moon and return safely to Earth, traveling farther than a...

item.title: Disney names Josh D'Amaro as its new CEO
item.description: D'Amaro will take over next month from Bob Iger, who has led the company for nearly two decades.

item.title: Trump takes questions on his call to "nationalize elections"
item.description: President Trump signed a bill Tuesday to fund the government and end the partial government shutdown. After, he took questions from reporters about wh...

item.title: Spain announces plans to ban social media for under-16s
item.description: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez says the move will protect children from the "digital Wild West".

item.title: Savannah Guthrie says her mom is a woman of faith and a source of strength for the family
NASA hopes to fix Artemis II moon rocket leak with on-pad repair
item.description: NASA plans to test the planned leak repair with a second dress rehearsal fueling test later this month.

item.title: Fourteen migrants dead after collision with Greek coastguard boat
item.description: The coastguard said a pursuit was under way at the time of the collision, near the island of Chios.

item.title: Defense seeks to block videos of Charlie Kirk’s killing in murder case, claims bias
Trial of Norway crown princess' son hears tearful account in rape trial
item.description: The first alleged victim begins giving evidence in Marius Borg Høiby's trial for rape and more than 30 other alleged offences.

item.title: Signs of forced entry found at Arizona home of ‘Today’ show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother
item.description: Investigators have found signs of forced entry at the Arizona home of “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother.

item.title: Ransom note being investigated in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance, sheriff says
item.description: The sheriff says the note was sent to a local Arizona news station, which agreed not to report on it, following the disappearance of "Today" show co-h...

item.title: House shelves contempt vote as Clintons agree to testify in Epstein investigation
item.description: The couple will appear on two separate days in late February for a deposition after coming to an agreement with the House oversight committee.

item.title: More companies are pointing to AI as they lay off employees
item.description: Although economists have generally downplayed the impact of artificial intelligence on jobs, some employers are highlighting their adoption of AI.

item.title: Tech executive warns of AI agents becoming dangerous if users give too much access
item.description: Scott Hanselman, vice president of developer community at Microsoft, joins CBS News to explain the difference between an LLM like ChatGPT and an AI ag...

item.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, reportedly shot dead
item.description: The 53-year-old, who was once widely seen as the second most powerful person in Libya, was killed on Tuesday according to Libyan media.
